title: U.N. Climate Warning Also Comes With Clear Steps To Cut Emissions
description: Humanity is failing to meet global climate goals. The good news is we know how to correct course.

title: Good News: Flu Shots Should Work Well This Year
description: According to data from the Southern Hemisphere.

title: The U.S. and Russia Need to Cooperate to End This Conflict
description: An enduring solution to the wider Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict can only happen if Washington and Moscow work together.

title: How Aristotle and Dante Discover the Secrets of the Universe Helped an Author and a Filmmaker Become Themselves
description: The director, Aitch Alberto, and the author, Benjamin Alire Sáenz, both grew into the truest versions of themselves alongside their art.

title: What Russia’s Regional Elections This Weekend Mean for Putin—and Ukraine
description: Here's what to know about the biggest elections in Russia since Vladimir Putin's decision to invade Ukraine.

title: A World Renowned Chemist Wants to Suck Water, and Carbon, Out of the Air
description: Omar Yaghi, one of the most cited chemists in the world, is developing materials that could help fight water scarcity and climate change.

title: Princess Diana’s Infamous ‘Black Sheep’ Sweater Is Up for Auction. Here’s Why It’s So Significant
description: The royal's infamous black sheep sweater is being sold for the first time. Here's the symbolic meaning behind it.

title: Why Everyone’s Debating the Meaning of Olivia Rodrigo’s New Song ‘Lacy’
description: The song 'Lacy' on her new album 'Guts' has many fans parsing lyrics to determine its subject, with several competing theories.

title: Georgia Special Grand Jury Recommended Charges for Lindsey Graham and 2 Ex-Senators
description: A Georgia special grand jury recommended indictments against a larger group than Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis ultimately charged, including one current and two former U.S. senators.

title: Landmark U.N. Study Warns of Widespread Failure to Meet Climate Goals
description: Countries are largely failing to meet their climate commitments, putting the planet on course for catastrophic global warming.

title: ‘Climate-Friendly’ Meat Is a Myth
description: Tyson's USDA-endorsed "climate-friendly" beef may be more greenwashing than planet-saving solution.

title: COVID-19 Is Mutating In Deer. That Could Become a Problem for People
description: A new study reports why COVID-19 viruses living in deer could come back to haunt humans.

title: 5 Steps Parents Should Take to Help Kids Use AI Safely
description: We have failed to prepare ourselves and our children for the advent of social media. We can't do the same for AI, writes Caroline Leaf.

title: The Changeling Is a Passionate But Frustrating Adaptation of Victor LaValle’s Masterpiece
description: Apple TV+ delivers a passionate but frustrating adaptation of Victor LaValle’s stunning 2017 novel.

title: China’s Concern About Nuclear Wastewater May Be More About Politics Than Science
description: It may be more about politics than science.

title: Why You Should Cultivate a Fluid Sense of Self
description: The key to navigating change in life is to have a diversified sense of self.

title: Why a Religious Scholar Is Focused on America’s White Supremacy
description: Robert P. Jones talks to TIME about the cyclical nature of white supremacy in America. "These are moves by desperate, fearful people."

title: Breaking Down the Ending of The Nun II—And Its Place in the Conjuring Universe
description: The Nun II is the ninth overall installment in The Conjuring franchise, but only the third chronologically.

title: McCarthy Lacks the Votes For an Impeachment Inquiry. Trump’s Allies Have a Plan to Get Them.
description: Far-right House members like Marjorie Taylor Greene aim to use public pressure to flip most of the 20 or so Republicans opposed to a formal impeachment inquiry.

title: North Korea Claims New Submarine Can Launch Nuclear Weapons, But There Are Doubts
description: South Korean officials were skeptical that the submarine would work as North Korea described and said it likely wasn’t ready for operational duty.

title: While Skipping G20 Summit, China’s Xi to Host Leaders of Debt-Ridden Zambia and Venezuela
description: The symbolism of Xi’s decision to host two world leaders as he snubs the G20 summit sends a clear message about how he prefers to conduct diplomacy.

title: Voters in Malaysia Jaded by Corruption Charges Are Turning More Toward Identity Politics
description: Observers say a jaded populace has started to trend back toward Malaysia’s historically divisive identity politics.

title: Determined U.S. Open Semifinal Win Brings Coco Gauff One Step Closer to Finishing the Job
description: After a determined U.S. Open semifinal win over Karolina Muchova, Gauff advances to Saturday’s final, marking the arrival of a new American player prepared to take women’s tennis into its future.

title: Attacks by Islamic Insurgents in Mali Kill Dozens
description: Three days of national mourning to honor the civilians and troops killed begin Friday.

title: Is India Still a Democracy? Political Prisoners Tell Their Stories
description: A new book, "How Long Can the Moon Be Caged?", shares the stories of India's political prisoners.
